tit.e: toso (the mixture of sawdust of paulownia wood and wheat starch)
Toso (the mixture of sawdust of paulownia wood and wheat starch)
tit.cmt: toso を Toso に修正しました。
tit.e: Toso (the mixture of sawdust of paulownia wood and wheat starch)

sen.j: 桐塑（とうそ）は、粘土の一種である。
sen.e: toso is a kind of clay.
Toso is a kind of clay.
sen.cmt: toso を Toso に修正しました。
sen.e: Toso is a kind of clay.

sen.j: 桐の粉末に正麩糊（しょうふのり）をまぜて作った粘土で、強度を出すために和紙が混ぜ込まれているものもある。
sen.e: toso is the clay made by mixing sawdust of paulownia with shofunori paste and is sometimes blended with washi (Japanese paper) in order to provide strength.
Toso is the clay made by mixing sawdust of paulownia with shofu-nori (wheat starch paste) and is sometimes blended with washi (Japanese paper) in order to provide strength.
sen.cmt: toso を Toso に修正しました。shofunori paste を shofu-nori (wheat starch paper) に修正しました。
sen.e: Toso is the clay made by mixing sawdust of paulownia with shofu-nori (wheat starch paste) and is sometimes blended with washi (Japanese paper) in order to provide strength.

sen.j: 作った直後は柔らかいが、乾燥すると強度が出る。
sen.e: Immediately after mixing, it is soft but it increases in strength when dried.
Immediately after mixing, it is soft, but it increases in strength when dried.
sen.cmt: soft but の間にカンマを入れました。
sen.e: Immediately after mixing, it is soft, but it increases in strength when dried.

sen.j: 土の粘土に比べ細部の再現性がよく、木のように表面を彫刻することが出来るため、木彫を量産したい場合に使用される。
sen.e: As it has better detail reproducibility than soil clay and its surface can be carved like wood, it is used for mass production of wood carving.
As it has better detail reproducibility than soil clay and its surface can be carved like wood, it is used for mass production of wood carving.
As it has better detail reproducibility than soil clay and its surface can be carved like wood, it is used for mass production of wood carving.
